content.description: A unique route, especially for taller folks. Stem, stem and stem your way up the gap between Upper GreyStone Wall and the pillar until you are full on spread eagle! Then commit to the face (crux) and climb perfect rock to the top.
content.location: Shares start, but not bolts, with Float Your Boat.

content.description: With a little bit of climber traffic/cleaning, this could become 4 star. Climbs much better than it looks. Meander your way through the choppy start (big holds but a little sandy, crux, stick clip first bolt?) to the fun rock above. There is an intermediate anchor two bolts from the top if you are not up for the steep finish or if the top anchor is being used by Spread Eagle climbers.
content.protection: 7-9 bolts to chain anchors (depends on which anchor you choose to stop at).
content.location: Start just right of FYB and SE.

content.description: Hard moves right off the ground get you through the crux and on to the cruiser face.
content.location: Left most route on Lower GreyStone Wall where the trail from the Foyer forks to either Shipwreck or Porcelain Walls.

content.description: Im not sure how this line has been overlooked. Big holds and a couple of pockets will get you off the ground, through the crux and on to the coolest rock in the area. Bullet proof Limestone with Chert bands....... ooooooweeeeee! Take the short but steep extension to the top if you didnt get enough!
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains for 5.9, 11 bolts to chains for 5.10 extension.
content.location: The next route looker's right of DMP. More or less climbs the blunt arete.

content.description: A hidden ramp. 5.fun! Anchors and grade have been lowered since originally climbed.
content.location: There is an obvious 'pillar' that separates the Lower and Upper walls. Float Your Boat climbs the West face of the 'pillar'.
